alert.note: Alert for Gates of the Mountains (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 06 at 10:46AM MDT until May 08 at 12:09AM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Great Falls MT has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Montana... Dearborn River at Craig affecting areas near the Dearborn River as well as nearby portions of Wolf Creek and Lyons creek. .The combination of higher elevation snowmelt and recent rainfall has led to rises on the Dearborn River and Lyons creek in Lewis and Clark county. Portions of these waterways are at bankful with additional runoff expected to bring some additional rises to to these waterways through tonight. For the Dearborn River...including Craig...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Dearborn River at Craig. * WHEN...From this morning to early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 5.8 feet the river is bankful and out of banks in isolated areas. At 6.5 feet, the river may come out of its banks within reach of the USGS gage and field flooding is likely north of the river and west of Highway 287. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM MDT Saturday the stage was 5.7 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached as early as this evening based on the latest forecast information. - Flood stage is 6.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Sunday morning. this evening at 1015 PM MDT.
